bboxes.raw_text:
The Maricopa County Council
for Retarded Children needs the
names of retarded persons, SIX
teen or older, who are willing
and able to participate job
training program. Possible
areas of training will be jani-
torial and domestic services,
laundry workers. nurserymen
and gardener aides, and food
handling.


If enough pers ons respond, the
program may start soon. Names
should be listed at the council
office. $50 West Indian School
Road, 277-76O5.

Phoenicians attending the AGA
18th annual state convention were
Betty Walton and Charlesetta
Lee. National Beauty Salon Week
programs were planned for Feb
ruary.


was elected as district rep
resentative of the fourth district.


Glenn Holden and G. w. Brown
of Winslow enjoyed their visit
to our city.


Miss Margaret Bolton gave a
good speech at the graduating ex-
ercises of the Practical Nurses
at Phoenix Union last week. Her
topic was "The Challenge"


Mrs. Louis B. Smith of Little
Rock, Ark, is visiting relatives
here.

ATLANTA Mrs. Coretta S.
King, wife of civil rights leader,
DR.. Martin L. King. Jr.. will
present a series of concert lee
ture appearances this fall across
the nation. She began her concert
career nine years ago.


A graduate Of Antioch College.
Yellow Springs, Ohio. Mrs. King
majored in music and elementary
education. She has studied voice
at the New England Conservatory
and holds bachelor Of music
from that school.


She will present songs related
to the freedom movement and
trace the present social revolu-
ton in words.


Mrs. King said. IL feel that
| have something to say about
the freedom struggle 80. none
of us is doing enough"

DIT. Ruby Blackshear attended
the weekend End annual con-
ference of the Arizona Credit
Union League at Casa Grande.


Antler Guard call meeting Sept.
FL, at lodge 7 pm.


Sick List: Bro. Bobbie Young
is in Memorial Hospital BIZ.
Robert Harris, husband of DIT.
Irma Harris is in county hospital.


Sept. IT PERC and PDRC
will meet in Flagstaff. Achar-
tered bus will leave the lodge at
l am. Round trip is only So.
We will go via Grand Canyon.
For further information or res
ervations call Bros. T. ]. Pratt
or Charles Williams.


The 1865 grand convention is
scheduled for Philadelphia.


We wish to thank everyone who
helped make our annual bathing
beauty and talent show a success.

James Netherland, Fl, Of l22O
S. 18th Ave., was arrensted in the
200 block of W. Washington after
five parking meters we're opened
and the money removed.


Netherland showed officers
how he opened the meters with
a dime.


He was booked for vagrancy
and theft from coin operated ma
chimes.

Bldg. Equip. Operator-S430-550

relations and public accommoda-
tions program of the city.

THESE RULINGS HAVE BEEN
UPHELD BY THE u. S. COURT OF
APPEALS, THE SUPREME COURT
AND ARE IN EFFECT IN MOST STATES


BUT ARIZONA is STILL


HAMPERED BY AN OUTMODED


EXCESS CREW LAW!
Only the voters can wipe this COSTLY obsolete law at the
polls! PROPOSITION 2OO-YES is safe, fair progressive
answer to the featherbeddng problem. 1t deserves your
support.

A Presidential Railroad
Commission, appointed by
Dwight D. Eisenhower,
found that firemen are
unnecessary on diesel
powered freight trains and
recommended their
elimination and the adoption
of procedures for reducing
the number of brakemen
in some instances.

TWO PRESIDENTS


AGREED.


FEbTHERBEDD|NC
IS CONTRARY TO THE
NATIONAL Welfare!

An Arbitration Board, under
John F. Kennedy, called
for elimination, with certain
restrictions, of fireinen on
eseI-powered freight
trains, and provided for
negotiation between


individual railroads and
brotherhoods on the
number of brakemen.
